sections.title: Research Planning
sections.content:
□ Clear research objectives defined
□ Research questions are specific and answerable
□ Appropriate method selected for objectives
□ Timeline is realistic and includes buffer
□ Budget and resources allocated
□ Stakeholders aligned on goals and expectations

sections.title: Ethical Considerations
sections.content:
□ Ethics approval obtained (if required)
□ Participant consent process documented
□ Data privacy and security measures in place
□ Compensation is fair and appropriate
□ Vulnerable populations considered
□ Right to withdraw clearly communicated

sections.title: Participant Recruitment
sections.content:
□ Target audience clearly defined
□ Recruitment criteria documented
□ Screening questions validated
□ Adequate sample size determined
□ Recruitment channels identified
□ Backup participants available

sections.title: Research Materials
sections.content:
□ Discussion guide/protocol reviewed
□ Materials tested with pilot participant
□ Recording equipment checked
□ Backup systems in place
□ Note-taking templates prepared
□ Stimuli/prototypes ready and tested

sections.title: Data Collection
sections.content:
□ Environment suitable for research
□ Consistent process across sessions
□ Researcher bias minimized
□ Participants comfortable and engaged
□ Technical issues documented
□ Data quality checked during collection

sections.title: Analysis Quality
sections.content:
□ Analysis method appropriate for data
□ Multiple researchers involved (if possible)
□ Findings grounded in data
□ Contradictory evidence considered
□ Limitations acknowledged
□ Confidence levels indicated

sections.title: Reporting and Impact
sections.content:
□ Findings clearly communicated
□ Recommendations actionable
□ Stakeholders can understand results
□ Next steps identified
□ Research artifacts stored properly
□ Impact measurement planned

sections.title: Common Pitfalls to Avoid
sections.content:
⚠️ Leading questions or confirmation bias
⚠️ Insufficient participant diversity
⚠️ Overgeneralization from small samples
⚠️ Missing edge cases or exceptions
⚠️ Ignoring contradictory data
⚠️ Recommendations without evidence
⚠️ Poor documentation of process
